intro: Bucida nitida, commonly known as the silverleaf bighorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
